headerText: The `v-menu` component shows a menu at the position of the element used to activate it.

usage.desc: Remember to put the element that activates the menu in the `activator` slot.

absolute.desc: Menus can also be placed absolutely on top of the activator element using the `absolute` prop. Try clicking anywhere on the image.

absoluteWithoutActivator.desc: Menus can also be used without an activator by using `absolute` together with the props `position-x` and `position-y`. Try right-clicking anywhere on the image.

hover.desc: Menus can be accessed using hover instead of clicking with the `open-on-hover` prop.

menus.desc: Menus can be placed within almost any component.

customTransition.desc: Vuetify comes with 3 standard transitions, **scale**, **slide-x** and **slide-y**. You can also create your own and pass it as the transition argument. For an example of how the stock transitions are constructed, visit [here](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/master/packages/vuetify/src/util/helpers.ts).

popover.desc: A menu can be configured to be static when opened, allowing it to function as a popover. This can be useful when there are multiple interactive items within the menu contents.

props.closeOnClick: Designates if menu should close on outside-activator click
props.closeOnContentClick: Designates if menu should close when its content is clicked
props.offsetX: Offset the menu on the x-axis. Works in conjunction with direction left/right
props.offsetY: Offset the menu on the y-axis. Works in conjunction with direction top/bottom
props.openOnClick: Designates whether menu should open on activator click
props.openOnHover: Designates whether menu should open on activator hover
